content.rendered:
As America changes, the tech industry has been slow to keep up. Over half of children born today are people of color, and 1 in 4 have an immigrant parent. Yet Silicon Valley and the U.S. tech economy do not look like our diverse population.  That results in a lot of missed opportunities for all of us.

Code the Dream recognizes that people from immigrant backgrounds and communities of color have great ideas and will play a huge part in our 21st century economy. Already immigrants are more than twice as likely to start their own business, and those businesses create over 25% of new jobs.

Can you imagine if more people with that drive knew how to code? Together we can make it happen. Download our brochure here.

Meet the Team

Ramiro Rodriguez

Co-Founder, CTO

Ramiro Rodriguez

Co-Founder, CTO
Ramiro knows about the American Dream and he knows about coding. Originally from Mexico, Ramiro moved to the United States as a child and excelled in school. He majored in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering at Cornell and later returned for a Masters in Computer Science. Together with an amazing team of top-notch volunteer instructors and mentors, he leads Code the Dream's teaching and project-based learning.

Daisy Magnus-Aryitey

Co-Founder, Co-Executive Director

Daisy Magnus-Aryitey

Co-Founder, Co-Executive Director
Daisy moved to the U.S. from Ghana at the age of 4. She lived in New Mexico, Connecticut, New Jersey, and New York before settling in North Carolina in 2009. She wrote her first line of code in a Code the Dream class, and within a year was working as a full-time software developer at Duke University. Daisy has played many roles at CTD, from a student in the initial CTD pilot to CTD Director to Board Vice-Chair. She has a Master’s in Education Innovation, Technology, and Entrepreneurship from UNC-Chapel Hill.

Dan Rearick

Co-Founder, Co-Executive Director

Dan Rearick

Co-Founder, Co-Executive Director
Dan took his own coding baby steps alongside the first Code the Dream participants. Having worked alongside low-income and immigrant communities since 2008, he was honored by the White House in 2013 as a Champion of Change. Dan co-founded Code the Dream together with Ramiro Rodriguez and Daisy Magnus-Aryitey, and is honored to work with an incredible team towards a shared vision of a more just and innovative world. Dan attended the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and Harvard Law School.

Lori Fernald Khamala

Director of Programs

Lori Fernald Khamala

Director of Programs
Lori Fernald Khamala has been involved with immigrant and farmworker organizing and advocacy in North Carolina for 20 years. She is passionate about building community rooted in social justice, equity, and collaboration. Lori joined the Code the Dream team in 2019 to strengthen new and existing relationships with nonprofit, education, business, and government partners.  She loves working with CTD's professional and student developers to identify innovative ways using tech to build a more just and inclusive world.

Pam Bash

Director of Development

Pam Bash

Director of Development
Pam has worked in both the corporate and nonprofit sectors and brings over 20 years of experience to her role in corporate, foundation and individual fundraising for Code The Dream. A native New Yorker and avid traveller, she jumped at the opportunity to live and work abroad teaching English in Turkey, Russia and Morocco. After 10 years, she finally returned to the US and eventually moved to North Carolina, where she brought with her a passion for education, diversity and community. She joined Code The Dream in 2020 and looks forward to building solid funder partnerships to help create and inspire future generations of coders.

Lucy Martinez

Chief Operating Officer

Lucy Martinez

Chief Operating Officer
Lucy Martinez has a passion for social justice and equity and over 15 years of experience at non-profit organizations and government agencies in the areas of anti-poverty, anti-hunger, and housing programs. At Code the Dream, Lucy uses her operations and human resources experience to help us accomplish our goals. Lucy is an AmeriCorps VISTA alumna and is a graduate of The Ohio State University where she earned her Bachelor’s degree in psychology.

Tom Rau

Senior Developer, Mentor

Tom Rau

Senior Developer, Mentor
Tom Rau has worked for startups and established organizations working in a variety of roles, ranging from product lead/manager to front-end development. At Code the Dream Tom helps develop the front-end curriculum as well as serves as a lead developer and mentor to Code the Dream Labs interns.  Additionally, Tom is pursuing a Masters of Science in Foresight Studies and occasionally still hits the road with a band as a bass or keyboard player.

Alex Rodriguez

Operations Manager, Web Developer

Alex Rodriguez

Operations Manager, Web Developer
Of all the folks at Code the Dream, Alex perhaps wears the most hats.  Alex started as a student in the React course and used those programming skills to pivot into WordPress.  In addition to being a lead WordPress developer, Alex also oversees many administrative responsibilities, and mentors new interns.  Alex is originally from Mexico and she resides in Cary.

Cruz Nuñez

Senior Developer, Mentor

Cruz Nuñez

Senior Developer, Mentor
Cruz got his start in the very first Code the Dream cohort. He's a fast learner, a creative problem-solver and just wicked smart -- all things that make him an excellent software developer. He's also the sort of helpful guy who hears that a friend is struggling with some tedious task, and then decides to code them an app over the weekend. He's a good guy to know. Cruz is also a gifted and patient mentor, and we're very glad to have him helping new Code the Dreamers get their start.

Andrea Hernandez Guzman

Senior Developer, Mentor

Andrea Hernandez Guzman

Senior Developer, Mentor
Andrea moved to the U.S from Mexico when she was a year old. She started taking Code the Dream classes in 2017 right after finishing up High School.  She focuses on building fast and beautiful web and mobile applications. Ultimately, she enjoys building cool things that can help people.

Justin Laidlaw

Engagement Manager

Justin Laidlaw

Engagement Manager
Justin is a life-long learner and native of Durham, North Carolina. He has an A.A. from Durham Technical Community College, and a B.A. in Journalism from North Carolina Central University. For six years, he worked as second-in-command at Durham-based clothing and lifestyle brand RUNAWAY before venturing into freelance multimedia production. In 2020, Justin started his own creative storytelling business called Buddy Ruski. He is passionate about the power of stories and how they connect us as humans.

Mary Alice Moore

Class Coordinator

Mary Alice Moore

Class Coordinator
Mary Alice was fortunate to find Code the Dream while working on her Associate's Degree in Web Design. After participating in their classes, she joined the intern team in August 2019. The following winter she became a proud first-time mommy.  Her beautiful family grew, she recently completed her degree, and her wonderful work family stuck by her, so she is back in a new role with Code the Dream as our Class Coordinator.  She feels very honored to be helping students and future interns join the Code the Dream family, build their skills, and brighten their futures just like she did.

Mariandrea Maldonado

Junior Developer

Mariandrea Maldonado

Junior Developer
Mariandrea was born and raised in Venezuela. In 2014 she started working with programming languages while she was studying computer engineering in her home country. She started the internet program at code the dream in 2020 and has been living in the Triangle since 2018. She is very passionate about playing piano, swimming, running, riding bikes, mathematics, and mental challenges. Mariandrea is fluent in Spanish too.

Chuck Anderson

Developer, Mentor

Chuck Anderson

Developer, Mentor
Chuck was born in NY and graduated from Adelphi University with a BS in Physics and a BA in philosophy.  He joined Code the Dream in the 2018 cohort for Ruby on Rails.  Since then he has tackled a wide range of topics from marketplaces to cryptocurrencies and enjoys learning new and varied solutions.  He has filled many roles from intern to lead developer and looks forward to the growth and challenges ahead

Lauren Sheridan

Project Manager

Lauren Sheridan

Project Manager
Lauren took her first programming class with Code the Dream in 2018 so she could create an app that would help hospital social workers like herself find supportive housing for patients discharging from long-term care. After another few years working in mental health, she returned to CTD as a Project Manager. In this role, she applies her drive to make life better for marginalized people using technology and enjoys supporting clients, colleagues, students, and new developers alike on their path to success. When she isn’t taking a deep dive to understand a problem and forecast potential solutions, you might find her playing with her two dogs, working in the garden, or managing the local rugby club.

Elsabeth Kidane

Junior Developer

Elsabeth Kidane

Junior Developer
Elsabeth was born in Ethiopia and raised in Eritrea. She earned her BA in Computer Science in 2011 and mainly focused on Cisco networking and computer maintenance. But she always dreamed of being a developer so in 2017 she came to the US to continue her education. Unfortunately, she was not able to obtain her master’s because it was very expensive to go to the university. Luckily, she got the chance to learn at Code the Dream for free. She started her course at Code the Dream in September 2019 and began her apprenticeship in December 2019 where she was able to work on real projects and learn to build both web apps and mobile apps. At the end of 2020, she become a proud first-time mom. She enjoys learning new things, in her spare time, she is studying UX design and tries to learn new tools that will help her to strengthen her knowledge.

Narayan Rai

Junior Developer

Narayan Rai

Junior Developer
Narayan grew up in Nepal and studied in India before coming to the States in 2008. He received a B.S. from the University of North Bengal, India, in Physics and Mathematics. He also received his two years degree in database management from a local community college. Narayan learned about Code the Dream from one of his teachers in school and he took advantage of the free coding classes offered. He has worked on various projects mainly focused on social changes such as improving the life of migrant farmworkers. In his free time, Narayan enjoys listening to music, helping his wife with gardening, and going on a bike ride with his two young daughters.

Rachel Frenkel

Senior Developer, Mentor

Rachel Frenkel

Senior Developer, Mentor
Rachel majored in Computer Science at Tufts University in Boston before vowing to only live in warmer places. With that in mind, she moved to California where she worked with various tech companies as a web developer, and in 2019 moved to southern Mexico. She believes strongly in the power of programming and was looking to find a way to use that to make a positive impact. She was lucky enough to find Code the Dream and be able to join this incredible organization and works from Mexico as a developer and mentor for CTD.

Board of Directors

Aris Buinevicius | Chair | Formerly Co-Founder / CTO, ChannelAdvisor.

Ana Maria Echeverri | Treasurer | Expert Labs Technical Training Program Director, IBM.

Diane Evia-Lanevi | Founder, The Tomorrow Fund for Hispanic Students.

David Laboy | Head of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Sustainability, Spoonflower.

Daisy Magnus-Aryitey | Co-Executive Director, Code the Dream.

Carlos Pignataro | CTO, Customer Experience, Cisco.

Manuel Ramos Gonzalez | Software Engineer, IBM.

Dan Rearick | Co-Executive Director, Code the Dream.

Susan Rohol | SVP and Chief Privacy Officer, WarnerMedia.

Selamawit Shibru | Front-end Software Developer, TCS.

Jennifer Zachary | General Counsel, Merck.
